alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Greeley; Howard; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 03 at 5:18AM CST until January 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...Snow and patchy freezing drizzle. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches, on top of at least a light glaze of ice. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...Until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on extremely hazardous road conditions. Increasing winds after sunrise will cause tree and power line damage due to accumulated ice and snow. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of light to moderate snow will continue through mid-morning, mainly north of a line from Lexington to Greeley where the heaviest snow accumulations are expected. Patchy light freezing drizzle and a light glaze is also possible, at times, this morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Greeley; Howard; Sherman; Valley
